required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observation of Clinical Routine Care for Patients With BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitors (ICMs)
clinical_study.official_title: BIO|STREAM.ICM: Observation of Clinical Routine Care for Patients With BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitors (ICMs)

brief_summary.textblock: This registry is performed for the long-term assessment of outcome, performance and residual safety aspects of the BIOMONITOR III and possible successors in a real-life clinical set-up. In addition, this registry is set up in a way that it may also be used as a platform for submodules to investigate additional scientific and regulatory aspects while minimizing the additional effort for the investigational sites and patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
primary_outcome.description: Device is intended to detect rare arrhythmias. Time to detect this relevant arrhytmia will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: It is considered that all patients are enrolled and subsequently inserted with the investigational device within 2 years after study start, i.e. until October 2021. Exchanges will be also considered for analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Information on the Insertion procedure (Operation time, handling of the BIOMONITOR incl. incision and inserton tool); Success rate of insertions.

other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Quality of sensing Amplitude (Millivolt) and electrical noise (%) detected by the BIOMONITOR.

other_outcome.measure: Inspection results of the insertion site
other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Rating of wound healing and cosmetic outcome by the physician/patient (5-level scale).

other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until Febraury 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Patients opinion about the wearing comfort (5-level-scale).

other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Assessement whether the BIOMONITOR migrates under the skin.

other_outcome.measure: Diagnosis and clinical actions after arrhythmia detection
other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Documentation whether the BIOMONITOR helps to detect arrhythmias. Documentation of therapies used to treat these arrhythmias and whether the BIOMONITOR helps to monitor therapy success.

other_outcome.measure: Explantation / deactivation / exchange information of the BIOMONITOR
other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Collect information about explantation, deactivation and exchanges of the BIOMONITOR, such as number, reason, and data on procedure.

other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Collect and analyze device deficiencies. Calculate rate (frequency) of device deficiencies.

other_outcome.measure: Documentation of imaging techniques, if applied.
other_outcome.time_frame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
other_outcome.description: Documentation if patients underwent any MRI examinations or mammography. Documentation of exact kind of examination and occurrences with regard to the BIOMONITOR.

study_pop.textblock: The intended patient population consists of all patients who would benefit from long-term cardiac rhythm monitoring.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is intended to receive a BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitor (ICM) or has received a BIOMONITOR III within the BIO|MASTER.BIOMONITOR III study
- Patient is able to understand the nature of the registry and to provide written informed consent.
- Patient is willing and able to use the CardioMessenger and accepts the BIOTRONIK Home Monitoring concept.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is pregnant or breast feeding.
- Patient is less than 18 years old.
- Patient is participating in another interventional clinical investigation other than the submodules of BIO|STREAM.ICM
